content: Should my canonical and current version URLs in package-list.json be http or https? The JIRA-Spec-Artifacts build warns if I use https instead of http. But if I use http, I get messages in the "publication rules" section of qa.html telling me I should use https.
note the entry for the continuous build should not use https...
canonical URLs need to be the same all around. (IHE has chosen https always) Im not sure what hl7 decision is.
Thanks John. I will use https for my canonical URL and ignore the JIRA-Spec-Artifacts warning, unless someone advises me otherwise.

Actually, it's an error from the JIRA-Spec-Artifact build, not a warning, so I cannot ignore it. Surely I am doing something wrong; otherwise everyone would have this problem.

ERROR: If present, ballotUrl must start with 'http://hl7.org/' FHIR-patient-corrections - actual was: https://hl7.org/fhir/uv/fhir-patient-correction
